Package Ex2

Class Ex2

java.lang.Object
Ex2.Ex2
public class Ex2
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a set of functions on a polynom - represented as array of doubles.
Author:
boaz.benmoshe

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static double EPS
    Epsilon value for numerical computation, it servs as a "close enough" threshold.
    static double[] ZERO
    The zero polynom is represented as an array with a single (0) entry.

  • Method Details

    • PolynomFromPoints

      public static double[] PolynomFromPoints​(double[] xx, double[] yy)
      This function computes a polynomial representation from a set of 2D points on the polynom. Note: this fuction only works for a set of points containing three points, else returns null.
      Parameters:
      xx -
      yy -
      Returns:
      an array of doubles representing the coefficients of the polynom.

    • equals

      public static boolean equals​(double[] p1, double[] p2)
      Two polynoms are equal if and only if the have the same coefficients - up to an epsilon (aka EPS) value.
      Parameters:
      p1 - first polynom
      p2 - second polynom
      Returns:
      true iff p1 represents the same polynom as p2.

    • f

      public static double f​(double[] poly, double x)
      Computes the f(x) value of the polynom at x.
      Parameters:
      poly -
      x -
      Returns:
      f(x) - the polynom value at x.

    • poly

      public static java.lang.String poly​(double[] poly)
      Computes a String representing the polynom. For example the array {2,0,3.1,-1.2} will be presented as the following String "-1.2x^3 +3.1x^2 +2.0"
      Parameters:
      poly - the polynom represented as an array of doubles
      Returns:
      String representing the polynom:

    • sameValue

      public static double sameValue​(double[] p1, double[] p2, double x1, double x2, double eps)
      Given two polynoms (p1,p2), a range [x1,x2] and an epsilon eps. This function computes an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p1(x) -p2(x)| < eps, assuming (p1(x1)-p2(x1)) * (p1(x2)-p2(x2)) <= 0.
      Parameters:
      p1 - - first polynom
      p2 - - second polynom
      x1 - - minimal value of the range
      x2 - - maximal value of the range
      eps - - epsilon (positive small value (often 10^-3, or 10^-6).
      Returns:
      an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p1(x) -p2(x)| < eps.

    • root

      public static double root​(double[] p, double x1, double x2, double eps)
      Given a polynom (p), a range [x1,x2] and an epsilon eps. This function computes an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p(x)| < eps, assuming p(x1)*p(x1) <= 0. This function should be implemented iteratively (none recursive).
      Parameters:
      p - - the polynom
      x1 - - minimal value of the range
      x2 - - maximal value of the range
      eps - - epsilon (positive small value (often 10^-3, or 10^-6).
      Returns:
      an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p(x)| < eps.

    • root_rec

      public static double root_rec​(double[] p, double x1, double x2, double eps)
      Given a polynom (p), a range [x1,x2] and an epsilon eps. This function computes an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p(x)| < eps, assuming p(x1)*p(x1) <= 0. This function should be implemented recursivly.
      Parameters:
      p - - the polynom
      x1 - - minimal value of the range
      x2 - - maximal value of the range
      eps - - epsilon (positive small value (often 10^-3, or 10^-6).
      Returns:
      an x value (x1<=x<=x2) for which |p(x)| < eps.

    • area

      public static double area​(double[] p1, double[] p2, double x1, double x2, int numberOfBoxes)
      Given two polynoms (p1,p2), a range [x1,x2] and an integer representing the number of "boxes". This function computes an approximation of the area between the polynoms within the x-range. The area is computed using Riemann's like integral (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral)
      Parameters:
      p1 - - first polynom
      p2 - - second polynom
      x1 - - minimal value of the range
      x2 - - maximal value of the range
      numberOfBoxes - - a natural number representing the number of boxes between xq and x2.
      Returns:
      the approximated area between the two polynoms within the [x1,x2] range.

    • getPolynomFromString

      public static double[] getPolynomFromString​(java.lang.String p)
      This function computes the array representation of a polynom from a String representation. Note:given a polynom represented as a double array, getPolynomFromString(poly(p)) should return an array equals to p.
      Parameters:
      p - - a String representing polynom.
      Returns:
